page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: {BARNTON AND LITTLE LEIGH 03600375} The area is mainly rural being a mixture of arable and dairy farming However it is overshadowed by the factory from which sprang the modern day ICI across the river in Northwich. Our two villages are almost the complete opposite of each other in character but are linked physically by the Weaver Navigation and the Runcorn Road.Little Leigh is a small scattered community centred round the church and surrounded by farmland.Barnton is one of the largest villages in England with correspondingly better public facilities.Originating at either end of the Trent and Mersey Canal Tunnel, it developed in stages the most recent being a large Council estate housing workers from a then expanding ICI and a smaller private estate.
